answers.answer: No, I've never heard that. Like people without diabetes, diabetics may take various supplements. The only one you hear about specifically with diabetes is Vitamin D because there seems to be a lot of diabetics with Vitamin D deficiencies. But there is no vitamin that is critical to be used with insulin. More important is eating a balanced diet with adequate vitamins and nutrients of all kinds.

question: Is it true that injecting insulin makes it critical to take B12 and/or B complex?
title: Vitamin Supplements
